post_text:
According to Department of Agriculture guidelines regarding identified school holidays, Troy ISD will not be distributing the “grab and go” meals on Friday, April 10 and Monday, April 13. All district offices will be closed on April 10 and 13. Also, the next instructional packet distribution will be on Tuesday, April 14th, at each campus.

Troy ISD will resume the “grab and go” meal distribution on Tuesday, April 14th at Mays Elementary School at 725 Main Street, Troy, Texas. The lunch and breakfast meals are free to all children 18 or younger and are available from 11:00 AM-12:30 PM on weekdays, until further notice.

Please, stay healthy.

post_text:
Beginning Wednesday, April 1, Troy ISD will change the “grab and go” meal distribution location to Mays Elementary School, 725 West Main Street in Troy. The “grab and go” lunch and breakfast meals are free to all children 18 or younger and will be available from 11:00 AM-12:30 PM Monday through Friday, until further notice.
Troy ISD has received guidance from the Texas Department of Agriculture that will allow parents/guardians to pick up meals for their children without the child being present.
Parents/Guardians will need to present one of the following:
• Individual student report cards
• Attendance record from parent portal of school website
• Birth certificate for children not currently enrolled in school
• Student ID card
Parents/Guardians may only receive meals for their own children.
No documentation is needed for children that are physically present at the meal distribution site.

Parents/Guardians will need to present one of the following:

• Student ID card

post_text:
Troy ISD is pleased to make “grab and go” meals more accessible to children in our community. During the COVID-19 pandemic, the United States Department of Agriculture has waived the requirement that children must be physically present in order to receive a school meal if the Texas Department of Agriculture develops a plan to maintain accountability and program integrity. However, as of Sunday evening, we did not receive the new guidelines from the Texas Department of Agriculture to implement this change. Therefore, the district will continue to require students to be physically present in order to receive school meals. We expect to receive the new guidelines very soon and will act as quickly as we can to provide meals for children that parents and guardians can pick up and deliver.

Thank you for your patience as we implement this change. Troy ISD remains committed to provide nutrition to the children in our community while following all state and federal guidelines.
text:
Troy ISD is pleased to make “grab and go” meals more accessible to children in our community. During the COVID-19 pandemic, the United States Department of Agriculture has waived the requirement that children must be physically present in order to receive a school meal if the Texas Department of Agriculture develops a plan to maintain accountability and program integrity. However, as of Sunday evening, we did not receive the new guidelines from the Texas Department of Agriculture to implement this change. Therefore, the district will continue to require students to be physically present in order to receive school meals. We expect to receive the new guidelines very soon and will act as quickly as we can to provide meals for children that parents and guardians can pick up and deliver.

Thank you for your patience as we implement this change. Troy ISD remains committed to provide nutrition to the children in our community while following all state and federal guidelines.

post_text:
Given the rapidly evolving situation with COVID-19 and the guidance we have received today from local health and county officials, Troy ISD will extend the suspension of normal district operations, in conjunction with surrounding districts, through the week of March 23-27.

Troy ISD has proactively begun the development of remote learning options for our students. We will communicate the details of these plans directly to Troy ISD staff, students and families in the coming days.
text:
Given the rapidly evolving situation with COVID-19 and the guidance we have received today from local health and county officials, Troy ISD will extend the suspension of normal district operations, in conjunction with surrounding districts, through the week of March 23-27.

Troy ISD has proactively begun the development of remote learning options for our students. We will communicate the details of these plans directly to Troy ISD staff, students and families in the coming days.

post_text: Troy ISD is now providing “grab and go” breakfast and lunch to all students 18 years and younger. Our meal program is being held at Troy Elementary School. These free meals are available to all children in the Troy area regardless of the district and school they attend. Please note, however, that each child must be present to receive a meal, per amended State requirement. Meals will be available for curbside pickup Monday-Friday at Troy Elementary School. Troy Elementary is located at 808 East Austin Street. Breakfast will be available for pickup from 7:30 AM-8:30 AM and lunch will be available from 11:30 AM-12:30 PM. This curbside meal service will be available until further notice.
text: Troy ISD is now providing “grab and go” breakfast and lunch to all students 18 years and younger. Our meal program is being held at Troy Elementary School. These free meals are available to all children in the Troy area regardless of the district and school they attend. Please note, however, that each child must be present to receive a meal, per amended State requirement. Meals will be available for curbside pickup Monday-Friday at Troy Elementary School. Troy Elementary is located at 808 East Austin Street. Breakfast will be available for pickup from 7:30 AM-8:30 AM and lunch will be available from 11:30 AM-12:30 PM. This curbside meal service will be available until further notice.

post_text: As a precaution against the spread of COVID-19, Troy ISD will cancel classes and all school activities March 16-20. In addition, faculty and staff will not report to campus. Troy ISD is in contact with local and state health officials and the Texas Education Agency and will continue to act to protect the health and well being of the greater Troy ISD community. Click for more information. https://www.troyisd.org/36626?articleID=50313

post_text: Construction is beginning on the renovations and additions at Troy High School! To keep students and staff safe during construction, fencing will be erected and the student entrance near the commons will be closed. Students will enter and exit the building using the doors near the Ag classrooms. Parents will line up for pick up and drop off near the Ag shop. Thank you for your patience while our facilities are improved.

post_text: Troy ISD School Nutrition pledged to serve more local foods for TDA's Farm Fresh Challenge throughout the month of October. This month Troy ISD students have enjoyed Texas- grown pears and gala apples from Top of Texas Apples, Farwell, zucchini squash from Panther Hollow Farms, Frio Town, watermelon from Luke Brown Farms, Balmorhea, Texas. #FarmFreshChallenge

post_text: October 14 is an early release day for all Troy ISD students. What is the purpose of the early release days? Twofold: 1) To provide special opportunities for students to experience and learn things not always in the classroom curriculum. And 2) So that teachers can also take time to learn and grow as professional educators. Be sure your son or daughter is present on October 14. They won't want to miss the interesting and exciting learning we have planned!

post_text: In Troy ISD, we strive for excellence, every day! Attendance matters! Parents and guardians received an attendance tracker refrigerator magnet--shown in the photo--by mail. If you didn't receive yours, contact the district office and we'll get it to you. Use the attendance tracker by entering the date each time your student must be absent. The fewer the absences, the better your student will do in school.
text: In Troy ISD, we strive for excellence, every day! Attendance matters! Parents and guardians received an attendance tracker refrigerator magnet--shown in the photo--by mail. If you didn't receive yours, contact the district office and we'll get it to you. Use the attendance tracker by entering the date each time your student must be absent. The fewer the absences, the better your student will do in school.

post_text: Based on unofficial election results, we are thrilled to announce that Troy ISD voters have approved the issuance of $18.25 million in bonds for facility improvements.The uncertified vote count was 291 for and 114 against. The Board of Trustees and our staff thank the voters for their trust and support. We pledge our commitment to continue being good stewards as we move forward with design and construction. This is an important step forward for our students and the entire community. We are excited about the future of Troy ISD!
text: Based on unofficial election results, we are thrilled to announce that Troy ISD voters have approved the issuance of $18.25 million in bonds for facility improvements.The uncertified vote count was 291 for and 114 against. The Board of Trustees and our staff thank the voters for their trust and support. We pledge our commitment to continue being good stewards as we move forward with design and construction. This is an important step forward for our students and the entire community. We are excited about the future of Troy ISD!

post_text: "The only thing that you absolutely have to know is the location of the library." --Albert Einstein Today's #TxEdTuesday focus is our school libraries. Books are still important, and our district librarian, Trista Falcon, and the library paraprofessionals, Emilie Darden, Megan Welch, and Candice Ainsworth, are working to help our kids to love reading. Thank you!

post_text: Monday, March 25 was a district-wide focus on service. Students at every campus worked on a variety of projects from making blankets to assembling care packages to writing letters. Seniors from Troy High School spent time with our younger students. It was a joy to see the Troy ISD family in service to the community and to each other. Here's a short video of just a few of the hundreds of students participating.
text: Monday, March 25 was a district-wide focus on service. Students at every campus worked on a variety of projects from making blankets to assembling care packages to writing letters. Seniors from Troy High School spent time with our younger students. It was a joy to see the Troy ISD family in service to the community and to each other. Here's a short video of just a few of the hundreds of students participating.

post_text: Students in Mrs. Martinez's geometry class recently applied their learning related to right triangles/trigonometry with a Zip-Line Project. Students created their own zip-line company, were given a budget, and were then tasked with designing three zip-lines: 1) Boring Ride--Barbie travels slowly or even gets stuck, 2) Dangerous Ride--Barbie could be injured, and 3) Safe and Fun Ride--Barbie safely travels the zip-line at a reasonable speed. Real-world application of mathematical concepts.
text: Students in Mrs. Martinez's geometry class recently applied their learning related to right triangles/trigonometry with a Zip-Line Project. Students created their own zip-line company, were given a budget, and were then tasked with designing three zip-lines: 1) Boring Ride--Barbie travels slowly or even gets stuck, 2) Dangerous Ride--Barbie could be injured, and 3) Safe and Fun Ride--Barbie safely travels the zip-line at a reasonable speed. Real-world application of mathematical concepts.

post_text: During their regular meeting on February 11, Troy ISD's Board of Trustees voted unanimously to call an $18.25 million bond election. If approved, the district will use the bond funds to complete substantial additions and renovations at district campuses. Early voting begins April 22 and ends Tuesday, April 30. Election Day is Saturday, May 4, from 7am to 7 pm. All voting will be held at the Troy ISD Administration Building. Details about the proposed bond projects may be found at www.troyisd.org under Latest News.
text: During their regular meeting on February 11, Troy ISD's Board of Trustees voted unanimously to call an $18.25 million bond election. If approved, the district will use the bond funds to complete substantial additions and renovations at district campuses. Early voting begins April 22 and ends Tuesday, April 30. Election Day is Saturday, May 4, from 7am to 7 pm. All voting will be held at the Troy ISD Administration Building. Details about the proposed bond projects may be found at www.troyisd.org under Latest News.

post_text:
The School Nutrition Department's annual Thanksgiving Luncheon will be rescheduled to Friday, November 16. The Trojan Senior Citizen Luncheon will, also, be moved to Friday.

Troy I.S.D. School Nutrition Department invites you to come join your
child(ren) in a traditional Thanksgiving Luncheon to be held on the following dates at the campuses regular lunch times.

Mays Elementary School: Friday, November 16th

Troy Elementary School
3rd & 4th Grades: Thursday, Friday, 16th

Raymond Mays Middle School: Friday, November 16th

Troy High School: Friday, November 16th

We would also like to extend an invitation to the Trojan Senior Citizens to come enjoy lunch with us at the Troy High School Library on Friday, November 16th at 11:00 AM.
